poem:
**Common Ground**

In the shadow of Busan, two titans meet—  
lost in the calculus of trade,  
where promises are spun from iron and silk.  
Words are coins tossed into the air,   
falling like leaves, neither heads nor tails.  
The price not of goods, but of bridges rebuilt,  
as tariffs fade like echoes in a vast, shared sea.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump-Xi meeting shows price of confrontation was too high for both sides When Donald Trump launched his trade war against China in April, threatening tariffs as high as 145%, the Chinese government said it would never bow to blackmail and vowed to “fight to the end”. The question now is whether the consensus reached between Trump and Xi Jinping in Busan, South Korea, on Thursday means that the fight really has come to an end,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Trump-Xi meeting shows price of confrontation was too high for both sides When Donald Trump launched his trade war against China in April, threatening tariffs as high as 145%, the Chinese government said it would never bow to blackmail and vowed to “fight to the end”. The question now is whether the consensus reached between Trump and Xi Jinping in Busan, South Korea, on Thursday means that the fight really has come to an end,
